Mark Boyes-Watson,, spoke in support of the new street overlay petition.  He stated that he has worked on affordable housing in cambridge for the past 25 years.

ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]

ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]

9. CMA 2019 #243 : A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item Number 19-95, regarding a report on whether idling vehicles may be added as a complaint category in SeeClickFix. PLACED ON FILE

Councillor zondervan stated idling vehicles are an epidemic.  why not use seeclickfix.

 

Police Commissioner explained the relatively low tickets for vehicular idling.  Due to number of exemptions for vehicle idling.

 

Vice-Mayor Devereux stated that she agreed with Zondervan.  Wanted to see educational marketing.

 

Councillor Kelley also expressed concern about the low level of ticketing.

 

Councillor Carlone asked about policy about repetitive warnings.  Commissioner stated that there is no policy about ticketing people who have received repetitive warnings. Agreed about promulgating advertising about idling.  seeclickfix not answer,

 

Councillor Carlone did not believe there are enough police to catch violators.

 

Councillor Zondervan spoke of the policy order.

City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. SeeClickFix idling vehicles 091619

17. CMA 2019 #251 : A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed amendments to the New Street Overlay District Zoning Petition. PLACED ON FILE

Iram Farooq,, explained some discrepancies with the petitioners commitments

 

Explained the responsibilities of the developer when building affordable housing through zoning.  Concerns about where the subsidy to build the units would come from.  Explained that the commitment is different than what is normally received.

 

Solicitor is explained spot zoning and differences with contract zoning.  Contract zoning is permitted based on case law.  Is this an enforceable contract and what is exchanged?  Not clear who owner is?  Building requirements as imposed by law.

 

Councillor Carlone stated that there is quite a bit of work on certain things.  Councillor Carlone asked about the adjacent site.

 

Solicitor explained that commitments from petitioner cannot include commitments from third-parties.

 

Councillor Sidiqqi stated that it feels like spot-zoning.

 

Councillor Simmons spoke in favor of giving the city and the petitioner more time to work on the agreement.

 

Vice-Mayor Devereux stated that the memo from CDD has convinced her not to support the petition.  Stated that petitioner is not giving anything.  Insulted by renderings as misrepresentation.

 

Councillor Mallon stated that she agreed with Vice-Mayor Devereux.  Solicitor agreed that agreement affects adjacent property. Also shocked by rendering.

 

Councillor Zondervan clarified that if petitioner could profitably build storage facility.

 

Mr. Roberts explained definition of storage facility in zoning ordinance.

 

Councillor Zondervan, Farooq explained that it is hard to give an opinion based on the diagram. 

 

Councillor Zondervan wants net-zero if moved forward.

 

Vice-Mayor reiterated conflicts with planning in that area.

 

Councillor Carlone spoke about the potential size and height of the building.

 

 

 

City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. New St Overlay Zoning Memo 09-16-19
b. NewStOverlay_CDDTextSuggestions_091619
c. NewStreetOverlay_DevelopmentSummary 091619

8. POR 2019 #259 : That the City Manager is requested to instruct the License Commission and City Solicitor’s office to drop all charges against UpperWest and its owners, to reconsider UpperWest’s package store application, and to issue a public apology to UpperWest and its owners. Order Failed of Adoption [1 to 7]

CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN ON 7.30.2019

Solicitor explained that statements about certain city officers have been vigorously denied and this motion affects pending litigation.

 

Solicitor explained why council could not discuss in public.  Charter question about council digging into personnel matters

 

Mayor McGovern asked if this could be discussed in executive session.  She explained that she is not sure if this was something that the council could discuss in executive session.

 

councillor kelley stated that he wanted a better undestanding of the case in executive session.

 

Councillor McGovern stated that he will coordinate an order for executive session on next monday the 23rd. 

 

councillor mallon, license commission have right to be present an right have meeting in open session.

 

councillor mallon stated that she was concerned about scheduling.

 

simmons confirmed city manager must agree.

 

simmons stated that council should not be involved in litigation.

 

Councillor Sidiqqi asked when the ABCC will hear these matters.  Stated ABCC may take a month or so to issue decision.

 

Councillor Carlone stated that he wanted an overview not great detail.

 

In response to question from Zondervan, Solicitor exlained how council could go into executive session and why.

 

Councillor Zondervan stated that he did not believe that policy order deal with any employees.

 

Solicitor explained why the order implicates city employees.

 

Mayor McGovern stated that he is planning to schedule a round table with the license commission.

 

Mayor McGovern stated that he is not comfortable with the policy order.

 

Toomey move to call the question.

 

councillor

13. POR 2019 #287 : That the City Manager is requested to work with the Police Commissioner, the Cambridge Carnival Committee, and the community to organize an alternative event to take place in Cambridge on the Carnival’s rain date, that will allow vendors to sell their products and potentially recover at least some of the costs. Order Adopted as Amended

Councillor Zondervan explained that he did not understand the unprecedented decision to cancel the carnival.

 

Felt that this could be indicative of ongoing racial discrimination in society.

 

Vice-Mayor Devereux spoke in support of the order.

 

Councillor Mallon stated that she wished the manager was present.

 

Councillor simmons stated that people of color do not put all their attention on one event.  Stated that she was present with grand-daughter when shots rang out a few years ago.  She stated that black community is more than this one event.  Wants to sit down with the planner to talk with the founder.

 

Councillor Sidiqqi

 

mayor mcgovern shared in the dissappointment of this event being cancelled.

 

Councillor Simmons stated that she wants the carnival creators to be a part of the plans.

 

Councillot Zondervan stated that the order should be sent to manager.

 

Councillor Simmons motion. recinded.

 

Motion by mayor mcgovern to insert the "mayor's office" into the first ordered paragraph.

 

Motion by mayor to insert ", or sometime thereafter" after "rain date" in the first ordered paragraph.
